stanza.line: When I do count the clock that tells the timetime
And see the brave day sunk in hideous nightnight
When I behold the violet past primeprime
And sable curls all silvered oer with whitewhite
When lofty trees I see barren of leavesleaves
Which erst from heat did canopy the herdherd
And summer green all girded up in sheavessheaves
Borne on the bier with white and bristly beardbeard
Then of thy beauty do I question makemake
That thou among the wastes of time must gogo
Since sweets and beauties do themselves forsakeforsake
And die as fast as they see others growgrow
And nothing gainst Time scythe can make defencedefence
Save breed to brave him when he takes thee hencehence
